message:
SYSTEM: 06_NonStandardOWLReasoning_ModularisationAndDebugging.pdf: Página 28
Justifications and root unsatisfiable classes
• There may be multiple justifications for an entailment
• For a given entailment, if there are multiple 
justifications they may overlap
• Removing one axiom from each justification breaks 
the justifications so that the entailment is no longer 
supported by the remaining axioms.
• A class is a derived unsatisfiable class if it has a 
justification that is a superset of a justification for 
some other unsatisfiable class.
• An unsatisfiable class that is not derived is a root 
unsatisfiable class, i.e., none of its justifications
contains a justification of another unsatisfiable class.
28
speaker: SYSTEM
